ReviewContent: Beautiful place, but now prohibitively expensive. Plus, you can t reach anyone on the phone, and the phone is answered by a computerized voice. This is the birthplace of the human potential movement? Not so much anymore. It used to be both beautiful and affordable for the average person. Really sad

It s great, as always. My only suggestion, the theme is  disconnect to reconnect. So why have Wi-Fi in any of the rooms at all? I understand having in the main dining area for people to check their messages. But I don t think it should be in the accommodations. Some of us cannot sleep at all with it on.
Faisal abbas 00923335236990
Someday I will come here, from across the river. Fey
One of the most incredible, special places. The land here is simply magical  if you add that to the not-to-be missed baths and a great workshop, you have an unforgettable experience.
Save your money, set your intention and give yourself permission to take a solo trip here. Disconnect to reconnect. Esalen is an antidote to the chaos of modern life. If youre ready.
Awesome grounds & inspiring community. A place to be!

This place was magical. I went solo for a 3-day weekend. I loved my bunk mates, the property, the food, the tubs, and the teachings. I felt so refreshed after. Highly recommend! It was worth every penny.

I really enjoyed my experience here. However, I do agree with a lot of the reviews - they really need better staff (not the faculty members) but the staff who are here on some temporary program. They need to be vetted better. A lot of them are extremely rude

I was blessed with the opportunity to take Lucia Horans 5Rythms Heartbeat & Mindfulness workshop this season. It was a life-changing experience going way beyond my expectations and I am deeply grateful to Lucia and Esalen community for this thoughtful cultivation of deep integration and healing. The accommodations, food, tubs and backdrop of Big Sur were spectacular but the workshop was one of a kind amazing. Highly recommended.
Open the hot springs back up to the public
Its our Rivendell.

I finally got to visit Esalen after years of trying to make it work. I cant remember the last time I felt so present. Something about this place demands you to be in the moment. Perhaps its the beautiful views, interesting/engaging folks around every corner, incredible food, and... lack of cell signal? I took a mindfulness course and it was a serious level up for my daily meditation practice. I am so grateful for my ability to visit, and hope to return again one day.
10/10 on every level. If you are considering going, take this as your sign to GO.

Not actually a place of spirituality, just a place for rich people to pretend. The vibes are very off, staff doesn t seem genuine and were rude. Much of the comments about this place not being like it use to, is true. It is no longer a place to go to genuinely grow and have access to spiritual healing on a community level. I have worked as a traditional medicine woman and much of what is taught here just screams fake and new age garbage to me. Overall, lack of accessibility, diversity, and superficiality gives this a one star for me. Plus, one of their workshops was based on eugenics and discriminated against autistic people. Like really? A place claiming to be a place of acceptance and spiritual healing allows this? We are all human and deserving of the same rights, respect, love etc.
Just wow, amazing place, workshop and food

The McKenna lectures recorded here & shared throughout the internet have made psychic tidal waves throughout all reality beyond comprehension. I hitch hiked right past Esalen once when I didnt realize what I was next to - not making that mistake again
My aunt used to come here in the 70s, said it was amazing. It s a shame it s become so profit driven, rigid and inaccessible
Incredible retreat center. Could not be more magical. I loved my experience here. The food is incredible. 10/10
Stunning and peaceful.
A stellar array of psychotherapists and intellectuals have taught at Esalen.

A really cool place but not a very warm and welcoming rescheduling option, they charge you extra $150 if you need to adjust to a different date even months in advance . Definitely ruined my experience with this facility and ended up canceling , those fees are outrageous too- read the fine print
It was pretty decent experience.

I spent a weekend there doing the self-guided option and sharing a room with two other women. The grounds are breathtaking. The food was delicious and very vegan friendly. Tons of veg options (I m vegetarian) and one meat option at the end of the buffet each meal. The people were friendly (staff and guests alike). Big fan of JJ! My one and only critique is that especially in light of there being no price difference between self-guided and the workshops that there be more things to do (yoga!) for the self-guided individuals.

Unbelievable.  Made deposite 2 1/2 days ago. Called back 2 1/2 days later. To cancel. It is a month away. She said nope we are keeping half your deposite.  What are you talking about.  To bad you didnt read the small print. Exact words! I said love and light? I said how would you feel? Well should of read the small print. Cant help to bad. Should of read the small printm . There is compassion at its finest I am going now.

I ve been to many Esalen workshops over the years but just being here is a worthwhile experience. I actually managed to get CEUs required for my nursing license on a few occasions and my company picked up the tab. Such a deal. Three days of workshops, hanging out in this beautiful, peaceful space, and I earned ten CEUs. I paid for one of those fabulous Esalen massages and went back to work both smarter and way more relaxed.
A very pleasantly hippie dippy place

I have heard of Esalen for many years and was really looking forward to going when I signed up for a craniosacral workshop through Upledger. Quite frankly I had one of the worst experiences of my life. First of all my dingy little room was not worth the $2000 I paid. At all. Ive stayed at better inns and beds/breakfasts for less. Second, I witnessed children pushing laundry carts which to me seems like child labor? Not ok. Also as soon as I was arrived I was literally screamed at by a staff member for crossing a bridge on car that HAD NO SIGNS. When I explained that it was my first time, I was lost, he continued to yell and scream, handling the situation completely inappropriately. Also the class I took is founded on theories of Eugenics? Especially as it pertains to those with Autism. I found this to be unprofessional at best and disturbing at worst. There was language in this course in regards to fixing or curing those with Autism. At the very least this is a dated ignorant viewpoint but it also very disturbing and dangerous. Individuals with autism are people, not science experiments, and are whole and complete as they are. Any language around fixing or curing autism is a red flag at best. I am hugely disappointed the institution would allow, support and endorse a course like this?? I will be pursuing options to get my money back this was frankly one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Overhyped.

Breathtaking landscape, and theres an energy there that makes your feel expansive. Great food, staff and comfortable accommodations.  Classes and workshops experienced really encourage going deep, wholeness and self discovery. The hot springs are extremely healing
What a wonderful view of nature. sound. color. air. Star. Sky. After seeing rivers and waterfalls, my outlook on life changed.
Amazing hot springs, great food, beautiful gardens. Paradise.

This place is nothing short of magical. I ve been twice and visiting again soon. Surprised to read the negative reviews. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The food was delicious, had an amazing massage and met very kind and interesting people.
Beautiful, great food, educational.

A nice place to relax and enjoy Human Potential Movement is limiting its potential to seekers who can afford it . I understand the financial obligations as it takes a lot to provide the facilities in Esalen I do feel management can innovate other smart ways to make money and reduce the tuition fee costs towards workshops by focusing less on luxury and more on exploring consciousness Scholarships are there to help, if you get accepted

A nice place for hot springs and relaxing by expressing your Sovereignty I feel Human  Potential Movement is limiting its potential to financially affordable seekers. Although I understand the financial obligations needed to provide that luxury in Esalen     . Scholarships help a little to only a few people but I do feel Esalen management can do more to reduce normal tuition fee costs and cover the money by hosting more affordable events for lesser Tuition or alternate ideas to gather funds needed.

There is no other word to describe Esalen than MAGICAL. It literally is a feast for the eyes, nose, ears, mouth and most of all the soul. Kindred spirits, hot baths, and nourishing foods. I just left my first visit with an inspired mind and full heart!
I am appalled by the rude staff I interacted with as I was trying to book a reservation. Very disappointing.

Simply magical.  Ive been a student and volunteer here for the last 20 years  and every time ive been here its be magical.  I can not say enough good things about the staff and teachers and the food is top notch.  Its always a treat to learn and grow here. Fantastic COVID policies.

Hit or miss, depending which crowd you fall into. One thing for sure, its not what it used to be, yet it relies heavily on its glorious past. If youre part of the overstressed silicone yuppie rat race, this may be your artificial relief valve, but not for authentic holistic followers. By now you get the point.

A pallid memory of what once was a blooming holistic eden. Based on my several visits which included overnight stays, I can honestly say its not the same Esalen. Cold, unfriendly, confused staff, displaying limited knowledge, completely out of touch with the true essence this Institute claims to posess. The place delivers nothing but an overall feeling of hollowness, leaving aside the genuine holistic spirit in favor of profits, yet it claims to be a non-profit organization. If you believe in Santa and dont mind blowing money into oblivion, then suit yourself and jingle bells.
One of my most magical places worldwide. Besides this wonderful location, all their Workshops are excellent!   I feel home and welcome! Not to forget: All about these incredible teachers! Thank you!

Basically my wife had scheduled a surprise herbal massage and wellness treatment for our anniversary. For years I have tried to schedule a visit but could never find an open availability or COVID shutdown cancelled any plans. Upon arrival we were denied entrance because apparently we could pay for services but not have a day pass. Apparently the website was not clear or allowed a purchase for a couples event. The massage was only 1.5 hours but the $400 couples session required another $400 for an additional Day pass for me if as they put it was a favor since we traveled all the way. $800 for only 1.5 hour couples massage just didn t seem appropriate or helpful. The woman at the security entrance was nice but could not explain why we were sold anything scheduled after 4pm given we were not staying on the premises. The whole experience was not professional or well managed. For years I wanted to experience the wellness and historical significance of Esalen. We were told that because of our trouble and this special circumstance they would make a special concession and refund my wife s anniversary gift as I was not interested in paying the additional $400 for an extra day pass for only 1.5 hours. No concern or option to reschedule for another day. As we sat in our car for over 15  to 20 minutes while the security person and management would call and try to understand their website and scheduling problem we watched as 3 or 4 old dented dilapidated cars exited the property. We watched as people walked to our entrance guard and interrupted repeatedly for towels and told they could have 2 towels only if they returned their towels or left them somewhere in  the system ? At that point I just wanted to leave. I am sad for my Wife who was very disappointed and left with her special anniversary surprise an absolute debacle. I was happy save the day with an excellent 4+ hour anniversary dinner at Post Ranch Inn. It is a shame Esalen could not honor our scheduled 1.5 couples massage and fix the issue with their reservation system. FYI bring your own towels if you do get the opportunity to experience this place. At this point I don t recommend the trouble or experience of going. My expectations have been severely diminished. Good Luck.

I used to frequent Esalen during the late 60s and 70s,  yes, the Murphy days. Moved out of CA only to return to Big Sur decades later on a cross country road trip. My plans included a pre booked two day retreat at the Institute, I wanted to come back so bad. Unfortunately, this time I was completely disappointed. Right off the bat and based on the prices charged, there is nothing about being a non-profit organization. Okay, I can live with that, but lets make it clear and dont mislead. Reception wasnt precisely warm or inviting, but rather rude and robot-ized. Bad start. I also noticed quite young staff with little or no true hands-on credentials, portraying an ambience of fake friendliness and rehearsed speech, only comparable to a car dealership. And that really bothered me. There is also a very strong sense of disregard (I will omit using the term discrimination) towards golden age folks, especially those of us who originallly contributed to the accolades this place currently enjoys. To add more insult to injury, vax is required, quite a baffling contrast to the natural healing concept the Institution strongly preaches, not to mention the mushroom ceremony. During my 2 day stay, I was never tranquil, much less in peace with myself or with the place. Instead, I was totally in disbelief and frustrated. Sure, the facilities and scenery remain spectacular, but unfortunately Esalens main core and unique magic are long gone. In summary, todays Esalen rides more on name and past glory than true fulfillment. It seems their priorities now focus on profits than actual healing. Quite sad to see a wonderful place taking a wrong turn.
Very surprised and disappointed with how Esalen has decided to respond to CV. Sad times for staff and guests who are no longer allowed to visit.

Very sad to see esalen falling into the vax pass. For the woman that spoke of kripalu, they require a test which is also the same animal. So they only want bougie vaxxed people. So long. We will create a new world now. Also agree mushrooms and vax I couldn t think of anything more twisted.
Absolutely fabulous place!! An experience of a lifetime.
Very sad to see their response to covid protocol. Was going to attend a massage workshop but will go to another institute like Kripalu that does not discriminate based on medical status.
Never will be what it was. Greed has taken over the owners of the place. Young children running the place. Rude, disrespectful. Such a shame, it was such a nice place for the beautiful people.

Booked the healing arts day pass, which gives you a 75 min massage and access to Esalen from 8:30 am - 4:30 pm for $345. It also includes lunch (although it should include breakfast if you arrive early enough/no one cares if you grab breakfast!). The views are stunning and the massage style is very unique as Esalen is a massage school. The baths are very relaxing and overall it was a lovely experience. I wish it included dinner and that you could stay to enjoy sunset! Leaving at 4:30 felt like I was missing out a bit.

This place is special and definitely worth visiting for a workshop! Douglas Drummond lead an incredible 3 day workshop for men that was transformational.    It was great to have a safe space for all walks of life to share their journey and their paths.  The space was beautiful,  the food options were healthy and fresh, and the hot spring pools/tubs are a perfect way to start or end the day after a workshop.  I will definitely be back for another retreat.
Ridiculous. Who wants to go to a place for a mushroom ceremony when they require vaccination passports? Artificial, big pharma supporting, What a joke. Fake  medicine

Following a sudden career transition- I was in need of a week to clear my head, meditate, do yoga, be around like-minded, fellow seekers and reset. Esalen helped me achieve this in many ways. The grounds are truly jaw dropping and gorgeous. The baths were magical with the natural heated spring water. The massage offering was wonderful and much needed. The other guests were all open and friendly and the views from my premium room were incredible. I arrived expecting a retreat center so I wasnt surprised to see the sparsely appointed room and tiny shower. I also expected a cafeteria style dining hall rather than a sit down restaurant. All good! Im sure some expect a more hotel like experience- this is not that. I was on a solo/ self-guided retreat alongside ten other folks. All of us there for various reasons. I appreciated the light programmatic options and that there was zero pressure to attend or not attend. During the week there was a massage training workshop and a womens retreat and those folks would pop in and out of the shared programming as their schedules allowed. I certainly left with a couple of new friendships and a much clearer head on my shoulders. JJ, one of the teachers, was warm, good humored and wise. I enjoyed my time with him and certainly left with new insights about life from him. On a more practical note: I also appreciated the free Tesla and EV chargers available for guests. Super helpful and pretty easy to access despite a full campus of Tesla driving guests. Also- Im glad I brought layers of clothing as they recommended. The weather was perfect - low 70s during the day but cool and damp at night being right on the water. This is why there are hoodies! A few negatives: They need to work on their cleaning- my room was littered with the last guests hair- an easy thing to remedy if the crew is trained and given the right tools. Im vegetarian and only one lunch or dinner the whole week didnt feature Tofu as the main option.  I am glad I brought snacks. Despite their website saying no kids under 16, three of the five days I was on campus there were kids running around. Not quietly in the corner- Im talking racing through the dining commons and bath house being loud and energetic. A huge reason I chose Esalen was to find tranquility so it was really disappointing to see that there are children running around on a frequent basis- even at the baths! When another solo-traveller brought this up to the Esalen team during the orientation, we were assured that it was an off day due to the Memorial Day Holiday and kids are never around.  Apparently he was too optimistic. I hope that in the future Esalen will work on diversity and inclusion. Theres a whole world of people who would benefit from this experience besides white women in leggings. It will require direct outreach to communities that may not resemble the staff or leaders at this organization. I hope they will be brave and figure out this key component to make Esalen stronger and the world a better place.
Stop trying to outsource your healing to bougie overpriced places like this. You heal you. Vax mandate speaks for itself.
Bucket list experience
Cool place!
So nice
Great place this is
10/10 would hot spring again

Esalen is a beautiful haven in the middle of Big Sur, a sanctuary for the soul.  I applaud Esalens staff for taking the necessary steps to protect their guests. Theres nothing courageous about this act, only compassion. I thank Esalen for living up to their motto of cultivating the Human Potential by being aware this comes not just from holistic work, but studied science. We live in unprecedented times and this takes extraordinary measures. Esalen is proving to be a step-above the noise once again, on the forefront of each generational movement, by creating a space for all to study safely, comfortably, and with grace and dignity.

I have read about Esalen and wanted to visit for years. I finally got the chance and was not disappointed. In fact I fell in love. This place is peaceful, sacred, magical, rejuvenating and worth every penny. I would give almost anything to have daily access to hot springs tubs and pool like that and with that view!! The food was decent, I felt they could take it up one notch at least. But I m picky. The landscape, the buildings, the view, the wildlife, all were spectacular. I m already looking forward to my next visit. If I could afford it, I d go every year.
Fantastic

Had a flat tire emergency after dark with 0 cell reception near the institute and Emily and James were such a lifesaver. They left such a good impression of the place and the community, the next time I am ever in USA I will try to join the workshops here! :)

Sad to see so many negative reviews because Esalen decided to make people who want to attend workshops get vaccinated during a deadly pandemic. Shame on you. Esalen is a wonderful healing place, and when I get to attend another workshop here I will feel safe. Thank you. Esalen is one of the most special, healing places in the world.

The Esalen that we knew and loved is no more...sad but true.The new management knows only their bottom line $$$$ and has made the cost of attending workshops for the generation which supported Esalens development the last 6 decades cost prohibitive. And do not get me started on their scholarship program which also discriminates against seniors. More importantly the management does not  walk the talk ; heck the one I spoke with had never even attended a workshop  there before  being hired for a management  position at the ripe age of 25. The sanctuary of the baths is not honored with silence nor reverence for  its healing potential. Rather it has  become a net working , hook up port for the tech crowd with disposable incomes and empty lives. Heartbreaking...

Shame on you for enforcing vax. That is not natural nor does it honor the body as a temple. Genetically altering the bodys natural immune system with what is now showing to be ineffective and dangerous is irresponsible!

Magical place which is well past its prime. In terms of human potential Ill quote Jack London, there was no there in the there there. The last seminar I took basically amounted to a corporate style fiesta of narcissistic Kabuki. It had nothing to do with spiritual development or personal creativity but more to do with the seminar leaders desire to fill up time via ostentatious displays of drama. My massage done by Corrine was heavenly. Im adding an addendum as of 11/21/2021... Something new and also very unwelcome and very much lacking the spirit of Esalen as it was. Turns out that Ive been spammed mercilessly by the seminar leader of the seminar I took during my last visit. There were three or four demands that I fill out long surveys and then endless advertisements to attend his next seminar in December. This is very very unwelcome... frankly, Michael Murphy must be rolling in his grave with this kind of stuff going on.
Thank you for ensuring the safety of all by requiring scientifically proven COVID 19 vaccinations for all attendees. I feel much safer attending knowing this.

This place is amazing. I am very grateful that the staff made the decision to ensure everyone is vaccinated who attends during the pandemic. I spend a lot of time with my elderly father and so have to be thoughtful and considerate in what events or workshops I go to. I m grateful Esalen made this decision so I could feel safe in my decision to attend. For those of you who choose not to be vaccinated and are complaining about Esalens decision- your personal beliefs are not more important than the safety of the elderly. These restrictions are in place because you are choosing to prioritize yourself above others safety. Stay home. And remember, YOU are the one choosing your own exclusion. Esalen is thinking about the greater good of people as a whole and I applaud them for doing so.

I ve taken two workshops here recently and both times was thrilled with the experience. It is expensive, but I see great value in what s offered, recognize the cost involved in the institute, and also note they have a scholarship program for those needing help. Don t let the negative reviews keep you from this experience if you feel drawn to it. The place is puts me in awe!
Magical, peaceful, grounding and the baths are one of a kind. You won t regret being here.
Amazing location and grounds. Super friendly people. Good food.

Boycott Esalen, they promote well being and natural medicine as a top priority then mandate experimental vaccines we don t even know the ingredients for to get into their retreat. Shocked and appalled and will never come here ever again.
Esalen institute discriminates people based on their vaccination status.  Nothing spiritual in such behaviour. Quite disappointing.
Place for healing and reconnection.

Esalen is a unique place full of history and extraordinary natural beauty. It is a retreat center, not a luxury hotel, although it does offer some luxury accommodations. The Institute offers a variety of workshops and retreats, and carefully vets the people who lead them. Many giants in the health, wellness, and spirituality fields have led programs here. Esalen is also rightly famous for its stunning natural hot spring baths, poised on the edge of a cliff above the Pacific surf, and its superb massage offerings--some of the best in the world. This gem was almost wiped out by the closure of Route 1 a few years ago followed by the current COVID crisis, but its dedicated staff are carrying on Esalens long tradition of hospitality. It is not for everyone, but if it IS right for you, you wont want to leave.
Clean food, yoga retreat with hot springs access overlooking Pacific Ocean. Massage was phenomenal brought me to tears. Kinda awkward being unclothed in hot springs with strangers

This place is funny. They fail to practice what they preach, we were met with hostility and pomposity from the guard. Immediately felt unwelcome, with outrageous prices it baffles me to see what this place is supposedly about. I drove several hours, to be so put off that I had to leave. I would not recommend. Save your money and find a place worth your time. You re better off in your car with a podcast, for something valuable and worth your time.

My experience was unfortunately quite disappointing.  I was met at the gate on the night of August 2nd with a quite rude security guard.  I felt unwelcome and uncomfortable.  I couldnt turn around fast enough.  I would not recommend this to a friend, and especially not a loved one.  NOT WORTH THE COST!

I attended an herb workshop here many years ago. The workshop was great - but this place is magical! This  was a one day workshop, but I was allowed use of the hot springs -  and all was ok that day! The feeling of being here has been with me for over 20 years. The Big Sur coast is beyond words - very special indeed.
My favorite place to just be.
lots of spinners
Took a meditation class there- life changing. Awesome food. Awesome people.

Esalen is a wonderful place in many ways. I too have been frustrated with registration issues. It is not a commercial company and that is precisely the basis for this organization to be so different that you are part of it and not just a consumer. For me, Esalen is like a second home, especially when I want to escape the crazy life of our everyday lives.
Nice & Beautiful
Life changing in a good way

I went there before and had great experience. This year I registered another two courses but then something come up and need change plan. Their cancellation police is not very kind at all. Even you are far away out of your retreat time, still they will change 50% of the deposit! Ouch! Be careful and be sure nothing changes in life so you won t loss the money!

I was planning to go to the springs with a larger party for my friend s birthday. Unfortunately the spots sold out too quickly and not everyone was able to make a reservation (the spots sell out within a minute). I then called and spoke to two very rude people on the phone who refused me a refund for my reservation made minutes before. Their attitudes simple defeated the epigram of their hot springs as a place to meditate, connect, and relax. 10/10 would suggest never reserving or coming to this place due to their inconsistencies with the greedy people in charge and the product their selling.

This is a place specialized in personal growth and well-being. Founded by Michael Murphy and Dick Price. The father of gestalt therapy: Fritz Perls held numerous workshops there. Its coverage goes much further: avant-garde, integration of East and West, approach with humanist roots. Some personalities with approaches related to Vital Autonomy have been presented here: Fritz Perls, Virginia Satir, Alan Watts, Aldous Huxley, Abraham Maslow, Will Schutz, Paul Tillich, Stanislav Grof, Ida Rolf, Moshe Feldenkrais, Carl Rogers, Buckminster Fuller, Rollo May, Joseph Campbell, R. D. Laing, George Leonard, Gregory Bateson , John C. Lilly, Carlos Castaneda, Claudio Naranjo, Fritjof Capra, Joan Baez, Deepak Chopra Andrew Weil. If you are interested in your personal development, updating your mind, realizing yourself as a person and unleashing your potential, then this is a perfect place for you.

A very interesting experience. We were booked for the couples heart tantra workshop, but found it a bit to newagy for us. They allowed us to switch to the yoga workshop, and we had a great time. The baths are incredibly beautiful and very soothing sulfur Hot Springs. It is clothing optional, but after about 10 minutes you stop caring. The only negative was that some of the food staff is a little snarly, but I understand that many of them are volunteers. Maybe they should be taught some better service skills, But otherwise the food was reasonably good, always healthy, and sometimes excellent.

From an interview with Vladimir Pozner: Strange things happen with running. You know, I was once in the States on the West Coast in a place called Esalen. Three waters converge there: the ocean, a mountain river and underground hot springs. We would say a spa, but this is in no way a spa; they call themselves Esalen Institute. It was founded by American psychologists Murphy and Price, followers of Aldous Huxley and his Human Development Movement. I have known Michael Murphy for a long time; he is a close friend of mine. People gather at Esalen to participate in seminars, psychological trainings, discussions about philosophy, mediative practices, and bioenergy. All outdoors, under the sun, in hot springs. Everyone is naked - both men and women. In short, an absolutely magical atmosphere. And then one day I went out there for a run in the morning and didn t notice how I ran 14 kilometers! Endorphins, so to speak. I didnt run, I flew. But anyway, first of all, I love game sports, and I like to play tennis seriously.
Such a unique place on our planet doing amazing things!!
Heaven on Earth!!
Very strange people. Just stay at a hotel.
Amazing place.  The spiritual vibrational energy is pure love and attracts those with similar vibrational energies.

This place is the essence of relaxation and pure beauty. Go into this place relaxed and ready to find yourself. Embrace it all this is a one and only experience. Staff was great. Old cabins were perfect. This is a little piece of heaven on earth. If you have the chance stay here a couple of days you won t be sorry.

One of the most beautiful properties in the world, and one of the poorest managed. The customer service and reservation process is simply remedial. Try calling and see if someone answers your phone call. Even worse, imagine giving them your hard earned money and calling. I will never return to this property again.
The entire compound is dedicated to peace, you will feel the energy and you will leave knowing that you can keep life stress free. You must book an reservation!!!!

For a group that supposedly honors the Esselen people, they sure seem happy to dismiss the concerns of the actual Esselen descendants. If they took spiritual enlightenment seriously they would be honest with themselves to see that they are acting entitled to, and taking something, that does not belong to them. If they actually cared about the Esselen people, or took their own spirituality seriously, they would have humility. They would step up and be serious about reflecting on their own actions. They wouldnt play fast and loose with the tribes traditions; and they would be serious about wholeheartedly respecting the wishes and concerns of the Esselen Nation.

This is going to be something to remember for quite some time. We visited for the night swim from 1-3 am.  You do need to arrive 15 minutes early, they walk you down the long hill and give you an orientation. The staff was great and had a good sense of humor.  The large majority of the group was nude in the springs and it was not uncomfortable at all.  They also have indivudal tubs if you dont want to be in the group.  The quiet side is definitely a better view and if you can go on a clear night it is truly stunning. Be ready right at 9 am to get tickets!!
Too expensive for everyday people.

Came here for a weekend workshop. Had an amazing stay. Very peaceful place. I found all of the staff to be friendly and professional, nothing like some of the bad reviews I read here. Food was pretty good. But really its about the location - it cant be beat. Highly recommend coming here just for a peaceful retreat. Enjoy the nature and sounds of the ocean as well as the creek nearby. The baths were awesome and the workshop itself was worth the while too (intro to mindfulness with James Baraz).

Late-night Hot-spring bathing was amazing. We went on a cold night during a full-moon which really added to the magic. The facilities are basic but decent and well maintained. The baths are located on a cliffs edge. So you have a fantastic view of the sea crushing onto the rocks below. There is a silent area and a quiet area, all the facilities are gender neutral and clothing-optional (most people will be naked) we highly recommend this to anybody. Make sure to bring your own towel and water container.
There was a extremely rude young gate attendant who really turned us off from exploring the grounds. The door guy made it known in a very disdainful  tone that it is by appointment only.
I work in the kitchen as the Lead Prep Chef feeding 700-800 meals a day for guests and staff. We host a multitude of workshops ranging from 3-28 day sessions.

I went to eselan last night for the late night bathing and it was a wonderful experience. I was worried that I would be able to see the ocean from the tubs, but they do a great job lighting up the ocean so that you can watch the waves crash on the rocks down below. Clothing is optional. Most people seemed to naked. There is something magical about being so calm in the hot springs water and listening to the chaos of the ocean below. Totally worth the middle of the night drive.

For such a revered, healing-centered entity, there is a glaring disconnect between Esalens stated mission and history, and the attitude of the staff we encountered there. Another reviewer commented on their experience of the staff here as: extremely rude; seemed not to care one bit about what had happened. Accurately describes the experience I had as a night bather at Esalen just a couple of weeks ago. Bear in mind that the night bathing takes place from 1 - 3 am. We (including my partner and her cousin) showed up early, as we were camping not far from Esalen. When it was time to walk down, we asked the gentleman leading us down the hill where we could get towels. He said they prefer not to give out towels, but that we could ask at the entrance kiosk. Hmm. Once we got down to the kiosk, we asked the woman there, named Tony I believe, if we could have towels. She refused, responding with a pedantic and dismissive, we dont give towels to night bathers, in a tone that indicated we were somehow both undeserving and foolish for even asking. As if she was doing us a favor. As if it were already charity to let us use the facility, and not $35 per person, and that giving us a towel was just going above and beyond. Yes, you read that right: An establishment that charges $35 a person for two hours for the express purpose of *being in water* refused paying customers towels. I suppose we could have just left at that point, but we had paid our money, waited around to walk down, and gotten our hopes up...so, we decided to brave it without towels. What else were we supposed to do? After making a reservation online, by the way, this is *verbatim* the text regarding towels on Esalens website: Please support Esalens sustainable practices and if possible bring your own towel and consider towel usage on the planet, thank you. Note the words, IF POSSIBLE. I have attached a photo and circled this statement on their towel policy from their website. One would infer from this that Esalen has towels for those who forgot to bring one, or in our case, for those who came from camping and dont necessarily have all of the amenities of someone staying at a hotel or coming from a home. The next phase of our experience is truly mind-blowing. To our absolute shock and dismay, we discovered a couple had brought AN INFANT along with them. Tony was all smiles and sunshine with them, though, as we waited to walk down to the baths. It gets worse. There are two areas of tubs: one marked, Silent Room (an actual room) and another Quiet Room (which is outdoors). After changing, we made our way into the Silent Room. Guess whos in there? The couple and their crying infant. In the Silent Room. At 1 am. WITH A CRYING INFANT. This meant everyone else (probably around 20 - 25 people) were forced to crowd into the Quiet Room while the couple and their infant held the so-called Silent Room hostage. When we were done (and we made sure to get out by 3 am since they were adamant that we get off the property, in their words, promptly by then) we put on our clothes, and walked back up the hill dripping wet. Ever put dry clothes on after a shower without toweling off? Lovely. Im still scratching my head wondering what we did to deserve such awful treatment. God forbid we ask for a towel for an experience that revolves around water and that we paid $35 each for. To add insult to injury, we were celebrating a birthday, and though we had never been to Esalen, were excited and talked the place up to our visiting guest. Perhaps it goes without saying that we will never return.
place wish I could live here!

Signed up to take a week-long program here, was put on the waiting list for sleeping bag quarters, and if nothing opened up, was told I would have a bunk bed reserved. Called to confirm prior to the course and was told they had lost my reservation and that there were no longer any (affordable) accommodations left. I was told the Director would call me to figure something out, but was never called back. The woman taking the reservations is extremely rude, seemed not to care one bit about what had happened. I looked in to staying off-site, but you still have to pay almost $600 in facility fees even if you stay off-site, so I had to cancel my trip to Esalen and the training course I was registered in (I was coming from Canada).Will never register for a course here again or visit the site. For the birthplace of the human potential movement I was expecting a lot more. Would not recommend!

We tried the public bathing from 1am-3am on a weekday, definitely an unusual experience but worth trying if you have an open mind. The facilities are basic but clean. The best baths are those on the cliffside, overlooking the ocean!
Best spiritual experience
One of the most special corners of the world. Insane views, the sulphur baths are magical and gentle, the staff and grounds are all exactly what one needs at some point in the year. Highly recommend.

very beautiful place, but if you go there, dont think you are learning anything. lots of sun, trees and music, but the staff there are so stuffed full of vapid thoughts about spirituality that they are starting to believe the intellectual con they are selling you. instead, approach it the same way that you would when you go to the movies, a fantastic but fictional ride that you set aside when you get back to the real world.
The most wonderful

Went with friends several times doing a personal retreat.  Extremely unique beautiful place to do that and only about 90 minutes from my house.  The one friend had done full workshops in the past and so led us to do personal retreats along with him.  The site takes your breath away with its beauty.  The food was copious and delicious though definitely not conventional.  Esalen has a half-century history as the arguable starting point of the human potential movement.  You can do a personal retreat for however many desired days without doing workshops.  A whole mix of people.  Clothing optional hot springs.
Ground Zero for the Human Potential Movement
A remarkable experience - the setting, the food, the people, the baths, the insights make for a once-in-a-lifetime experience.
A must
Esalen will reopen again Jul 28, 2017, once the roads are cleared and it is accessible again.
Extraordinary place. Worth every penny.
Awful from beginning to end. Rude, self-important staff. Dont waste your time.

Can hardly wait to return to this epic healing place of natural beauty and uplifting workshops  Stephen Harper runs a brilliant wilderness hiking workshop that we will return to,  again and again to enjoy,  both on the inner and outer.
Naked hot springs 12-2
A nice play to have a soak in between 1 and 3. Reservation required. The best is the view on the ocean and the sounds of the breaking waves.

It would be very, very hard to describe in words this place. For one thing, its one of the most staggeringly beautiful places on Earth. For another, its made of its wonderful, crazy, delightful people. Clothing-optional hot springs and the broad range of workshops make this one of the most special places anywhere. Go if you have any way to do so!
The best massage ever. Great view, by the cliffs, hearing the waves hitting on the cliff, relaxing environment.
I have been a visitor since 1968, I keep coming back for the relaxing baths and cool vibes.
Very good to go back to the source
Great Site, Interesting Offerings, Quite High Prices.

Open to the public on Tuesday nights or something like that. Amazing experience. Sitting in natural hot springs on a cliff overlooking the pacific ocean watching the moon reflect on the water and the sound of the waves below.
Very beautiful natural hot springs overlooking the ocean, sweet grounds, tasty food, good vibes from people, and great workshops.
Beautiful!  Friendly and helpful staff, laid-back atmosphere, awesome food, amazing gardens.  And the most wonderful massage Ive ever had.  And sea otters!
The nightly spa is really an experience.

The food, hot springs, and programs were amazing.  The view and whale watching were also to die for.  Bunk bed rooms were not too bad!  Staff were friendly and helpful.  (You cannot go on the property if you are not CHECKING IN that day... dont take it personally LOL  its not a cult :)

My most favorite place to be ever. My first visit was in 1998. To say it was transformative would be a huge understatement. My heart was opened, my mind was challenged and my life was blown wide open. I have never been the same since and it is wonderful.  It is a laid back, no cell phone slice of heaven. The food is the best, fresh and healthy right out of the garden. The most interesting people hang out here. The bodyworkers on staff are some of the most talented and diverse I have ever experienced. I will be there next weekend for my 10th and not last visit.

Great memories of being here assisting with training, seeing the view of the ocean and hanging out in the hot tubs. Now I have to warn you the staff can very from friendly, to a bit moody, to seeming they are a bit annoyed that you are disturbing them.  If you see that as part of the experience then you will enjoy your experience more.
Amazing!

Love going there whenever possible! Discovered it years ago at a low point in my life and now return several times a year. Hot tubs are fantastic and food is good although Im not a vegetarian. Beautiful setting on the coast with wonderful workshops and community of people.
This is a magical retreat where theres so many open minded people together. Hard to explain but really nice to decompress after burning man. The hot tubs, gardens, food, wildernis hikes... Just go!
Very interesting place, life changing for sure
Like no other place on Earth!

Life-changing.  I will always and forever think of Esalen as one of those places that made my life shift for the better.  I do pretty well for myself from an outside perspective, but Esalen made me realize the importance of joy in my life... no longer do I have the desire to do more and make more... I have the desire to do less, give more, and enjoy life more, and just be.
Nice place!! They just let me get in to the parking lot and then go back to the entrance, bad sense of professionalism!
